Reviews.Title: Love It!
Reviews.Author: D. Hausman
Reviews.Content: I owned a previous Panasonic Lumix camera. It was too big and bulky. I bought this one because it was a top rated pick at Consumer Reports. I am very happy. This has some of the same features and functionality of my previous model improved. It is easy to use. Very quick pictures. Small and easy to put in youp pocket. I love the intelligent auto feature. I would recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FP8
Reviews.Author: Lori
Reviews.Content: I've had it about a month now and I really like this camera.  It has a lot of features that I need to learn to use but, it's a great camera.

Reviews.Title: Good little camera
Reviews.Author: Shadow
Reviews.Content: This Panasonic camera is a good little camera.  It is relatively easy to use and has a host of advanced features that I never intend to use, at this time anyway.  Before buying the camera I read many reviews online.  The primary concern that the online reviews had, and that I noticed when I use the camera is that the picture quality in the  "intelligent auto"  mode is not as good as some other cameras.  What I did, as recommended by the web reviews, was to  adjust the normal picture mode to be at 800 ISO or lower.  Since it is very easy to switch between the "intelligent auto mode" and the  "normal mode", I will switch between the modes as I deem necessary.  It is not perfect but it is very good.

Reviews.Title: Buy the correct battery...
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I have only had the camera under a week and so far, it is a nifty little camera and I think we will enjoy it very much.My problem is in ordering extra or replacement batteries for it.  Please be sure that you order the DMW-BCF10PPIf you order the other battery that Amazon has, you will find that it does not fit into the camera or the charger.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FP8 12.1MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Gregory T. Fuess "Greg"
Reviews.Content: does what it is supposed to do.  The camera is a little complicated, maybe too complicated for a shirt pocket camera.  With all the bells and whistles on this thing, it is probably capable of higher quality photographs than it produced for me because I do not know how to select the right settings for this thing.A few weeks ago, a friend and I compared several photographs, me with this and her with an Olympus she purchased at the airport in 2004.  The sharpness and clarity of that camera was superior.  Did I have the correct camera settings?  Probably not.  Would the Panasonic have outperformed a 6 year old camera had the correct settings been used?  Who knows, because I never could figure out which settings those would be.This Panasonic camera was the highest rated in the compact digital camera by Consumer's Reports.  It out performed the Kodak previously owned, and previously the rated highest by CR in the same catagory.  All these cameras are complicated, and the general setting does not justify buying a new camera.
